nodes.text: Things no-one else is crazy enough to be doing right now: final prep for a trip to answer one of the great unanswered questions: just how far can you travel by bus from London in 24hrs? I *think* I know on paper, but in practice…? Follow along from 3am as I slowly go mad. #bus24 https://t.co/Ga8hzYwgP6
@mjray @politic_animal @BhsMuralHull Yes I prefer to see a red neon pyramid from miles away as intended! *You may well be right that the ‘rule’ applied to the church not The Point.

@Andromedary123 @politic_animal @BhsMuralHull I thought the rule was that nothing could be higher than the planned city church that took decades to build? But now you can see the cross from miles away, which feels a bit odd for a modern multifaith city
@politic_animal 😂...che simpatico!

@LongWeekenders I’m sure the lovely scenery around Little Kimble made up for it! (Once got completely lost walking around there and eventually realised we were on the private drive to Chequers. Still amazed we survived that!)
@politic_animal Totally agree about #Aylesbury. Used the bus to get to the start of the North Bucks Way at Great Kimble, depressing start to the ramble.
@OhMyGerardz Certainly quite dominant in much of the East Midlands and North West.

@politic_animal That’s pretty crazy - especially as down here, we’re a smaller operator (versus First West of England); I do forget that other depots are the main bus provider for the town/city.

@OhMyGerardz Haven’t done the maths, but I expect Stagecoach provided the largest mileage on the trip of any operator. Northampton-Leicester and Bolton-Morecambe, plus the journey through south Manchester.

@foxya3xx @politic_animal Just worked out a plan based on leaving Ashton-under-Lyne at 0423 (on the 219 bus) and arriving in Dundee for 2340 (99D bus): • 10h 1m from Keswick to Dundee; • 6h 21m from Ashton to Keswick; • 36m lunch at Keswick; • 39m tea at Dumfries; • 29m bacon butty at Preston.
